intro: Sahagunia racemifera, commonly known as the clustered leaf yew, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia, particularly found in countries like India and China. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that bloom in yellow or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
